required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Exposure to an Informative Video on Maternal Anxiety
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Exposure to an Informative Video Regarding Possible Obstetric Emergencies on Maternal Anxiety and Peripartum Satisfaction- A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Stress and anxiety during childbirth have negative consequence on both mother and fetus. Previous studies have learned the effect of several intervention to reduce anxiety during labor- such as music and foot reflexology. Nevertheless, data for informative video before labor for reducing stress and anxiety are sparse. The present study aimed to review and determine the effect of informative video on anxiety, pain and outcomes of the labor in primigravida women.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized control trial studying the effect of exposure to an informative video regarding labor and possible obstetrics emergencies on maternal anxiety and postpartum satisfaction

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory score in delivery room
primary_outcome.description: STAI questionnaire before and after delivery room

arm_group.description: Nuliparus women admitted to an induction will be exposed to informative video with data regarding labor and possible obstetric emergencies such as cesarean delivery. All patients will answer the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) before and after intervention
no intervention. All patients will answer the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) before and after delivery.

intervention.description: Informative Video group before labor in nulliparous women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
above 18 years of age Nulliparus women Informed consent Reads and understand Hebrew >37 weeks of gestation
Exclusion Criteria:
Refuse to participate Contraindications for vaginal delivery
